text: Nonlinear Equations in One Variable Fixed point iteration Clicker 10: multiple roots Newton’s method and bisection are applied to the function f(x) = 23e®, whose zero is x* = 0, with an initial guess zy = 1 for Newton’s method and an initial interval [—1, 1] for bisection. What can we say about the convergence of these methods: @ There is not enough information to determine convergence of Newton’s method and bisection @ Bisection will converge but Newton’s method is not defined because f’'(z*) =0 @ Newton’s method will convergence linearly and bisection quadratically @ Newton’s method will converge quadratically and bisection linearly @ Newton’s method will converge linearly and bisection linearly Ascher & Greif (UBC Computer Science) A First Course in Numerical Methods CPSC 302, Fall 2023 44 /46 Your Answer: E
